Notes.Text:
This update for freeradius-server fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2017-9148: Disable OpenSSL's internal session cache to mitigate
  authentication bypass. (bnc#1041445)
- CVE-2015-4680: Add a configuration option to allow checking of all
  intermediate certificates for revocations. (bnc#935573)

The following non security issue was fixed:

- Cannot create table radpostauth because of deprecated TIMESTAMP(14) syntax. (bsc#912873)

Vulnerabilities.Description: FreeRADIUS 2.2.x before 2.2.8 and 3.0.x before 3.0.9 does not properly check revocation of intermediate CA certificates.

Vulnerabilities.Description: The TLS session cache in FreeRADIUS 2.1.1 through 2.1.7, 3.0.x before 3.0.14, 3.1.x before 2017-02-04, and 4.0.x before 2017-02-04 fails to reliably prevent resumption of an unauthenticated session, which allows remote attackers (such as malicious 802.1X supplicants) to bypass authentication via PEAP or TTLS.
